title: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Insight Remote Support DESTA Service Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Hewlett Packard Enterprise Insight Remote Support. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the DESTA service, which listens on TCP port 7901 by default. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of user-supplied data, which can result in deserialization of untrusted data. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of SYSTEM.
addtionnal_details: Hewlett Packard Enterprise has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://support.hpe.com/hpesc/public/docDisplay?docId=hpesbgn04731en_us&docLocale=en_US
timeline:
2024-09-19 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2024-12-02 - Coordinated public release of advisory
2024-12-02 - Advisory Updated
